name: Sweetwater Creek State Park
description: Sweetwater Creek State Park is a 2,549 acre state park just west of the city past six flags. It has about 12 miles of trails. Sweetwater creek cuts through the park. The George H Sparks Reservoir provides still waters for fishing, boating, and other water activities. Camping and cabins can be reserved.
parking: Parking is $5 or free with a Georgia State Park pass.
